channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tip at entrance to alleyway, 28th December
item.description:

item.title: Car contents emptied onto Thames Path, 28th December
item.description:
Piles of rubbish and what looks like the contents of the car of an Amazon delivery driver. Leaflets, high Vis, car mats, possibly parts of a dashboard & other things like shoes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Andrews Close, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The footpath has been shut for over 6 months., 28th December
item.description:
The paving slabs and block paving were taken up by contractors to remove a tree stump outside 95 and have not been made good. In addition outside 97 there are a number of cracked slabs which are a trip hazard. I am worried that due to the shut footpath forcing children and elderly into the path of traffic that someone will be injured as the part of the road is on a bend where cars often speed along giving no time for hazards in the road like people.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, Hayes Chase, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Issue: Bins occasionally not returned properly, 28th December
item.description:
After some collections, bins are left blocking gates or walkways. This doesnâ€™t happen every time, but it does occur occasionally and creates avoidable obstruction. Please could the crew be reminded to return bins to their original positions and keep access

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cromford Path, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This car has been dumped from since the beginning of October, 28th December
item.description:

item.title: Vandalism to play park equipment, 27th December
item.description:
Vandalism to another piece of park equipment (burned slide and climbing straps) in addition to broken slide, disc swing etc. This has been broken and cordoned off for many weeks now and this park is a staple to our community. Our young children would play here almost daily. Please review progress and expedite repairs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riverside Road, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
